intro: Pterolepis simplicicaulis, commonly known as the simple-stemmed pterolepis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, unbranched stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers that are typically arranged in umbels. It is native to certain regions of southern Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and unique morphology, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
